template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a realistic end-to-end operational workflow in the {industry} domain that would require coordinating multiple tools, resolving at least one constraint, updating systems, and delivering a final outcome; output only the prompt text and keep it under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a realistic end-to-end operational workflow in the manufacturing domain that would require coordinating multiple tools, resolving at least one constraint, updating systems, and delivering a final outcome; output only the prompt text and keep it under 40 words.

message.content: When a machine fault delays a priority order, coordinate tools to reroute production, update inventory and maintenance logs, and ensure the order ships on time.
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, the user wants me to generate a single-sentence prompt in plain English about a manufacturing workflow. Let me break down the requirements: it needs to be realistic, end-to-end, involve multiple tools, resolve at least one constraint, update systems, and deliver a final outcome. Also, under 40 words.

Hmm, manufacturing... think of common scenarios. Maybe production planning with machine breakdowns? Or quality control issues delaying shipment? Wait, combining these could work. 

Need multiple tools: perhaps inventory system, scheduling software, maintenance logs. Constraint could be a faulty part or machine downtime. Updating systems like ERP or WMS. Final outcome—shipped products. 

Let me draft: "When a machine fault delays a priority order, coordinate tools to reroute production, update inventory and maintenance logs, and ensure the order ships on time." That’s 22 words. Checks all boxes: tools (production routing, inventory, logs), constraint (machine fault), updates (inventory, logs), outcome (ship on time). Yes, that fits.
